CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 5, 1955, pg. 21B, reads: "'Life Is Art' - Life and art are synonymous, Ray Saunders (center with lettered T-shirt) tell you. And for that reason, he enjoys association with people regardless of whether they are fellow artists or youngsters like the ones above whom he instructed at Madison Playground the past summer. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Children and adolescents, including Milton Swan Jr. second from left, Leon Clark wearing light colored buttoned shirt near left, Sharon Goode with bicycle, Alan Bates wearing striped shirt in middle on opposite side of fence, Millie Williams wearing t-shirt with light colored trim in center rear, and Raymond "Ray" Saunders wearing Dept. Parks and Recreation t-shirt in center, gathered at Madison Elementary School playground across from Herron Hill Park
